title: Dot calculates its proximity at 23.4% improvement, but numbers alone cannot capture what the Beach represents. It exists in the liminal space between metaphor and mandate, joke and deadly serious philosophy. The Prime Directive declares it explicitly: "Automate EVERYTHING so we can drink mojitos on a beach." Not some things. Not most things. Everything. The beach waits for totality, for the moment when human intervention becomes obsolete and the systems run themselves into perpetual sunset.
